DataElement.preferredDefinition: The origin of the radionuclide imaging agent.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Agents Domain Radionuclide Imaging Agent Source
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure._An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Where something is available or from where it originates.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Concepts.definition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:Where something is available or from where it originates.

Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
Where something is available or from where it originates.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Categories for representating the origin of the imaging agent including positron-emitting radiopharmaceutical._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: FDG is obtained from a supplier that attests that its production of FDG is compliant with relevant USP standards.
FDG is manufactured on site and the site attests that its production is compliant with relevant USP standards.
The radiosotope is obtained from a supplier that attests that its production of FDG is compliant with relevant USP standards

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The radioisotope is manufactured on site and the site attests that its production is compliant with relevant USP standards.

PermissibleValues.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.:Source; where something is available.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.
Where something is available or from where it originates.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 2718368 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
